Description: The temptation of Saint Antony (first plate); rocky landscape crossed by a river, with monstrous creatures; nude female figure on a carriage made of bones in the centre. c.1617 Etching
Dimensions: Height: 284 millimetres (trimmed; cut in the middle)
Curator's comments: This is the first version of the subject, etched in Florence in 1617, which was never published as the plate was ruined in rebiting. See Anna Grelle Iusco, 'Matrici incise dal '500 al '900', Calcografia Rome, 2004, p.58, for the information that two fragments of the cut-up plate were used by Filippo Napoletano for his series of skeletons.
Bibliographic references: Meaume 1860 / Recherches sur la vie et les ouvrages de Jacques Callot (138)
Associated names: Representation of: St Antony of Egypt
Acquisition notes: From the Scarisbrick collection of Callot's work: see comment on 1861,0713.1.
